member.name: T:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord
member.summary: Class DeathRecord models a FHIR Standard Death Record (SDR). For consuming a FHIR SDR (in either XML or JSON format), there is a constructor that takes a string, which will parse the given FHIR SDR and build a new DeathRecord that represents it. You can then use the various property getters to infer details about the record. For producing a new FHIR SDR, there is a default no-param constructor that creates the bare bones necessary for a new record. You can then use the various property setters to populate details of the record. All DeathRecords can be converted to FHIR XML or JSON suitable for transmission, by making use of the ToXML() and ToJSON() methods.

member.name: F:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.Navigator
member.summary: Useful for navigating around the FHIR Bundle using FHIRPaths.

member.summary: Bundle that contains the death record.

member.summary: Composition that described what the Bundle is, as well as keeping references to its contents.

member.summary: The decedent.

member.summary: The Certifier.

member.summary: Default constructor that creates a new, empty FHIR SDR.

member.param: represents a FHIR SDR in either XML or JSON format.
member.exception: Record is neither valid XML nor JSON.

member.returns: a string representation of this Death Record in XML format

member.returns: a string representation of this Death Record in JSON format

member.summary: Decedent's Given Name(s). Middle name should be the last entry.
member.value: the decedent's name (first, etc., middle)

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.FirstName
member.summary: Decedent's First Name. This is essentially the same as the first thing in GivenNames. Setting this value will prepend whatever is given to the start of GivenNames if GivenNames already exists.
member.value: the decedent's first name

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.MiddleName
member.summary: Decedent's Middle Name. This is essentially the same as the last thing in GivenNames. Setting this value will append whatever is given to the end of GivenNames if GivenNames already exists.
member.value: the decedent's middle name

member.summary: Decedent's Family Name.
member.value: the decedent's family name (i.e. last name)

member.summary: Decedent's Maiden Name.
member.value: the decedent's maiden name (i.e. last name before marriage)

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.Residence
member.summary: Decedent's residence.
member.value:
Decedent's residence. A Dictionary representing residence address, containing the following key/value pairs:
"residenceLine1" - residence, line one
"residenceLine2" - residence, line two
"residenceCity" - residence, city
"residenceCounty" - residence, county
"residenceState" - residence, state
"residenceZip" - residence, zip
"residenceCountry" - residence, country
"residenceInsideCityLimits" - residence, inside city limits

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> residence = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.value: the decedent's social security number

member.summary: Decedent's Place Of Birth.
member.value:
Decedent's Place Of Birth. A Dictionary representing a place of birth address, containing the following key/value pairs:
"placeOfBirthLine1" - location of birth, line one
"placeOfBirthLine2" - location of birth, line two
"placeOfBirthCity" - location of birth, city
"placeOfBirthCounty" - location of birth, county
"placeOfBirthState" - location of birth, state
"placeOfBirthZip" - location of birth, zip
"placeOfBirthCountry" - location of birth, country

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> placeOfBirth = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.PlaceOfDeath
member.summary: Decedent's Place Of Death.
member.value:
Decedent's Place Of Death. A Dictionary representing a place of death, containing the following key/value pairs:
"placeOfDeathTypeCode" - place of death type, code
"placeOfDeathTypeSystem" - place of death type, code system
"placeOfDeathTypeDisplay" - place of death type, code display
"placeOfDeathFacilityName" - place of death facility name
"placeOfDeathLine1" - location of death, line one
"placeOfDeathLine2" - location of death, line two
"placeOfDeathCity" - location of death, city
"placeOfDeathCounty" - location of death, county
"placeOfDeathState" - location of death, state
"placeOfDeathZip" - location of death, zip
"placeOfDeathCountry" - location of death, country
"placeOfDeathInsideCityLimits" - location of death, whether the address is within city limits (true) or not (false)

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> placeOfDeath = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.MaritalStatus
member.summary: The marital status of the decedent at the time of death. Corresponds to item 9 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value:
The marital status of the decedent at the time of death. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code describing this finding
"system" - the system the given code belongs to
"display" - the human readable display text that corresponds to the given code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> code = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.Disposition
member.summary: Disposition of the decedent’s body. Corresponds to items 18, 19, 20, 21, 22 and 23 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value:
Disposition of the decedent’s body. A Dictionary representing the disposition, containing the following key/value pairs:
"dispositionTypeCode" - the code describing the method of disposition of the decedent’s remains
"dispositionTypeSystem" - the code system describing the method of disposition of the decedent’s remains
"dispositionTypeDisplay" - the human readable code display text that describes the method of disposition of the decedent’s remains
"dispositionPlaceName" - the name of the disposition place
"dispositionPlaceLine1" - disposition place address, line one
"dispositionPlaceLine2" - disposition place address, line two
"dispositionPlaceCity" - disposition place address, city
"dispositionPlaceCounty" - disposition place address, county
"dispositionPlaceState" - disposition place address, state
"dispositionPlaceZip" - disposition place address, zip
"dispositionPlaceCountry" - disposition place address, country
"dispositionPlaceInsideCityLimits" - disposition place address, whether the address is within city limits (true) or not (false)
"funeralFacilityName" - the name of a funeral facility or institution
"funeralFacilityLine1" - funeral facility address, line one
"funeralFacilityLine2" - funeral facility address, line two
"funeralFacilityCity" - funeral facility address, city
"funeralFacilityCounty" - funeral facility address, county
"funeralFacilityState" - funeral facility address, state
"funeralFacilityZip" - funeral facility address, zip
"funeralFacilityCountry" - funeral facility address, country
"funeralFacilityInsideCityLimits" - funeral facility address, whether the address is within city limits (true) or not (false)

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> disposition = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.Education
member.summary: Decedent’s level of education. Corresponds to item 51 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value:
Decedent’s level of education. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code describing this finding
"system" - the system the given code belongs to
"display" - the human readable display text that corresponds to the given code

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> code = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.summary: The decedent’s age in years at last birthday. Corresponds to item 4a of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.

example.para: Console.WriteLine($"Age in years at last birthday.: {ExampleDeathRecord.Age}");

member.summary: Decedent’s usual occupation and industry. Corresponds to items 54 and 55 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value:
Decedent’s usual occupation and industry.
"jobDescription" - Type of work done during most of decedent’s working life. Corresponds to item 54 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
"industryDescription" - Kind of industry or business in which the decedent worked. Corresponds to item 55 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> occupation = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.CausesOfDeath
member.summary: Conditions that resulted in the underlying cause of death. Corresponds to part 1 of item 32 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value:
Conditions that resulted in the underlying cause of death. An array of tuples (in the order they would appear on a death certificate, from top to bottom), each containing the cause of death literal (Tuple "Item1") the approximate onset to death (Tuple "Item2"), and an (optional) Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code describing this finding
"system" - the system the given code belongs to
"display" - the human readable display text that corresponds to the given code

example.para: Tuple.Create("Example Immediate COD", "minutes", new Dictionary<string, string>(){ {"code", "1234"}, {"system", "example"} }),
Tuple.Create("Example Underlying COD 1", "2 hours", new Dictionary<string, string>()),
Tuple.Create("Example Underlying COD 2", "6 months", new Dictionary<string, string>()),
Tuple.Create("Example Underlying COD 3", "15 years", new Dictionary<string, string>())

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.ContributingConditions
member.summary: A significant condition that contributed to death but did not result in the underlying cause captured by a CauseOfDeathCondition. Corresponds to part 2 of item 32 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value: A significant condition that contributed to death but did not result in the underlying cause captured by a CauseOfDeathCondition.

member.summary: Whether an autopsy was performed (true) or not (false). Corresponds to item 33 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value: Whether an autopsy was performed (true) or not (false)

member.summary: Were autopsy findings available to complete the cause of death? Corresponds to item 34 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.

"system" - the system the given code belongs to

Console.WriteLine($"Did tobacco use contribute to death: {ExampleDeathRecord.TobaccoUseContributedToDeath["display"]}");

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.TimingOfRecentPregnancyInRelationToDeath
member.summary: Timing Of Recent Pregnancy In Relation To Death. Corresponds to item 36 of the U.S. Standard Certificate of Death.
member.value:
Timing Of Recent Pregnancy In Relation To Death. A Dictionary representing a code, containing the following key/value pairs:
"code" - the code describing this finding
"system" - the system the given code belongs to

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> code = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: P:FhirDeathRecord.DeathRecord.DetailsOfInjury
member.summary: Injury incident description.
member.value:
Injury incident description. A Dictionary representing a description of an injury incident, containing the following key/value pairs:
"placeOfInjuryDescription" - description of the place of injury, e.g. decedent’s home, restaurant, wooded area
"effectiveDateTime" - effective date and time of injury
"description" - description of injury
"placeOfInjuryLine1" - location of injury, line one
"placeOfInjuryLine2" - location of injury, line two
"placeOfInjuryCity" - location of injury, city
"placeOfInjuryCounty" - location of injury, county
"placeOfInjuryState" - location of injury, state
"placeOfInjuryZip" - location of injury, zip
"placeOfInjuryCountry" - location of injury, country
"placeOfInjuryInsideCityLimits" - location of injury, whether the address is within city limits (true) or not (false)

example.para: Dictionary<string, string> detailsOfInjury = new Dictionary<string, string>();

member.name: T:FhirDeathRecord.IJEMortality
member.summary: A "wrapper" class to convert between a FHIR based DeathRecord and a record in IJE Mortality format. Each property of this class corresponds exactly with a field in the IJE Mortality format. The getters convert from the embedded FHIR based DeathRecord to the IJE format for a specific field, and the setters convert from IJE format for a specific field and set that value on the embedded FHIR based DeathRecord.

member.summary: FHIR based death record.
